Task: Update tool-call UI in /Users/sawyerhood/swarm to look more like the reference implementation in ~/do-browser/redo.

User request: "make the tool call ui look more like ~/do-browser/redo"

Please do the following:
1) Inspect current tool-call UI components in this repo and identify files controlling rendering/styles.
2) Inspect ~/do-browser/redo for the analogous tool-call UI (structure, spacing, typography, status chips, borders/background, animations, iconography).
3) Implement a close visual match in this repo without breaking existing behavior.
4) Keep accessibility and dark/light theme compatibility intact.
5) Run relevant checks (at least ui tests/build).

Deliverable:
- exact files changed
- concise description of visual changes
- commands run + results
- any follow-up recommendations (if there are additional nice-to-have parity tweaks).

arguments.message:
Completed: tool-call UI refresh to match do-browser/redo style.

Inspection findings
1) Current swarm tool-call UI ownership:
- apps/ui/src/components/chat/MessageList.tsx
  - `ConversationLog` currently renders all log kinds (including tool_execution_*) as bordered monospace blocks.
- No separate tool-call component existed; styles were inline Tailwind classes in this file.

2) Reference implementation inspected:
- /Users/sawyerhood/do-browser/apps/redo/src/components/chat/ToolCallCard.tsx
- /Users/sawyerhood/do-browser/apps/redo/src/components/chat/MessageList.tsx
(~/do-browser/redo path does not exist on disk; analogous implementation is in apps/redo.)

Reference characteristics mirrored:
- Collapsible row structure for tool events
- Small italic line text with left status/iconography
- Spinner for running state, contextual success/error/cancel icons
- Chevron rotation on expand/collapse
- Compact expanded details with labeled sections and muted code blocks

Implemented changes
- Updated tool log rendering in:
  - apps/ui/src/components/chat/MessageList.tsx
- Added a new tool-log presentation flow inside MessageList:
  - tool-specific status mapping (`pending/completed/cancelled/error`)
  - per-tool friendly labels/details (bash/read/write/edit/list_agents/send_message_to_agent)
  - status chips (Running/Done/Failed/Cancelled)
  - collapsible details panel with animated expand/collapse
  - preserved full payload visibility in expanded `pre` blocks (input/update/result/error)
  - retained timestamps + tool metadata
- Added mapping by `toolCallId` so non-start events can show original start input in expanded details.
- Kept non-tool conversation logs (message_start/message_end) behavior intact.

Accessibility + theming
- Used semantic buttons for collapsible trigger with `aria-expanded` + `aria-controls`.
- Kept focus-visible ring styles.
- Used theme-token classes (`foreground`, `muted`, `border`, `destructive`, etc.) for dark/light compatibility.

Commands run + results
- pnpm --filter @swarm/ui test
  - PASS (1 file, 5 tests)
- pnpm --filter @swarm/ui build
  - PASS (client + SSR + nitro build succeeded)
- Re-ran both after final tweaks; still PASS.

Exact files changed
- apps/ui/src/components/chat/MessageList.tsx

Follow-up parity recommendations (optional)
- If you want even tighter redo parity, split tool logs into a dedicated component file (like redo’s `ToolCallCard.tsx`) to simplify future UI iteration.
- Optionally reduce borders on non-tool runtime logs to match the lighter, less “cardy” look throughout chat.
- If backend can emit normalized tool input/result fields (instead of raw JSON text), we can remove heuristics and improve friendly summaries further.

data.text: (non-text message)

Done — implemented and validated.

### 1) Current tool-call UI files (swarm)
- `apps/ui/src/components/chat/MessageList.tsx`
  - This is where `conversation_log` entries (including `tool_execution_*`) were rendered/styled.
- No separate tool-call component existed before; styling lived inline in `MessageList.tsx`.

### 2) Reference implementation inspected (redo)
- `~/do-browser/apps/redo/src/components/chat/ToolCallCard.tsx`
- `~/do-browser/apps/redo/src/components/chat/MessageList.tsx`
- Note: `~/do-browser/redo` didn’t exist on disk; equivalent is under `apps/redo`.

### 3) Exact files changed
- `apps/ui/src/components/chat/MessageList.tsx`

### 4) Visual/UI changes made
- Reworked tool execution logs into **redo-like collapsible rows**:
  - icon + italic summary text + chevron
  - spinner while running
  - success/error/cancel icon states
- Added **status chips** (`Running`, `Done`, `Failed`, `Cancelled`).
- Added expandable detail area with labeled blocks (`Input`, `Update`, `Result`/`Error`) using muted bordered `<pre>` sections.

content.name: send_message_to_agent

arguments.message:
Scope update completed: included full-width layout adjustments alongside redo-style tool-call UI.

Exact files changed
1) apps/ui/src/components/chat/MessageList.tsx
2) apps/ui/src/routes/index.tsx
3) apps/ui/src/components/chat/AgentSidebar.tsx

What changed
A) Redo-style tool-call UI (MessageList.tsx)
- Replaced generic tool_execution log cards with redo-like collapsible rows:
  - left status iconography (spinner/success/error/cancel)
  - friendly italic summary text
  - rotating chevron on expand/collapse
  - compact status chips (Running/Done/Failed/Cancelled)
  - expanded detail blocks with labeled Input/Update/Result/Error sections
- Added per-tool friendly labels/details for bash/read/write/edit/list_agents/send_message_to_agent.
- Kept non-tool logs (message_start/message_end) as standard runtime log cards.
- A11y: semantic button trigger + aria-expanded/aria-controls + focus-visible ring.
- Theme-safe token usage for light/dark parity.

B) Full-width layout (index.tsx)
- Removed centered max-width constraint from app shell:
  - before: `mx-auto ... max-w-[1400px]`
  - after: full-width `w-full` layout with overflow-safe container.
- This makes the chat/tool-call surface use full available width.

C) Tool-call component width behavior + responsive polish
- MessageList inner content now uses responsive horizontal padding (`px-3 sm:px-4 lg:px-5`) so full-width doesn’t feel edge-to-edge.
- Tool-call summary text changed from truncation to wrapping (`break-words`) so cards can use available width.
- Tool payload `<pre>` blocks set to `w-full` so expanded content fills available width.
- Sidebar width made responsive (`w-48 sm:w-56 md:w-64 lg:w-72`) to avoid excessive squeeze on small screens.

Verification / checks run
- `pnpm --filter @swarm/ui test` ✅
  - Result: 1 file passed, 5 tests passed.
- `pnpm --filter @swarm/ui build` ✅
  - Result: client build + SSR build + nitro build succeeded.
  - Only existing upstream Vite/TanStack unused-import warnings observed; no failures.

Notes
- Reference used: `/Users/sawyerhood/do-browser/apps/redo/src/components/chat/ToolCallCard.tsx` and related MessageList.
- `~/do-browser/redo` path did not exist locally; analogous implementation is in `apps/redo`.
